page.title: 13PRESERVED WOODLAND
page.content: There are two areas of{'preserved {woodland',}this means they will always be there as no trees can be cut down without permission. Both are part of {Woodbarns Farm Knowle Green,}one is called{Mashay Wood}and the other is {Twelve Acre Wood}even though it is really 32 acres. A haven of wild life. Most of the large trees are oak, nearly all the elm trees are dead because of the{'dutch elm disease' There are also maple, ash, hornbeam, hazel, willow, spindle, hawthorn around the edges and some scrub and black-berries. There are all sorts of {wild flowers,}some extremely rare such as{Herb Paris}and{Oxlips.}There are foxes,grey squirrels,jays,redstarts, treecreepers,magpies,longtailed tits, pheasants,partridges, as well as all the common woodland birds, blackbirds, thrush,robins,cuckoos,pigeons,sparrows
